author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: نْ بَابِكَ وَلا تَطْرُدْنِيْ عَنْ شَاطِئِ حُبِّكَ وَرِضَائِكَ، لأنَّ الفَقِيرَ لا يَجِدُ لِنَفْسِهِ مَلْجَأً إِلاَّ بَابَ غَنَائِكَ، وَإِنَّ المَطْرُودَ لا تَسْتَقِرُّ نَفْسُهُ إِلاَّ فِي جِوارِ عِنَايَتِكَ، أَيْ
translation: Cast me not from Thy presence, O my Lord, neither do Thou drive me away from the shores of Thy love and Thy good pleasure. For the poor can find no refuge unless he knocketh at the door of Thy wealth, and the outcast can find no peace until he be admitted to the court of Thy favor.
